cards.name: Arcanine
cards.text: This legendary Chinese Pokémon is considered magnificent. Many people are enchanted by its grand mane.

cards.name: Azumarill
cards.text: When it plays in water, it rolls up its elongated ears to prevent their insides from getting wet.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Clefable
cards.text: With its acute hearing, it can pick up sounds from far away. It usually hides in quiet places.

attacks.name: Fairy Power
attacks.text: Return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

cards.name: Gyarados
cards.text: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Hitmontop
cards.text: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.

attacks.name: Triple Kick
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Close Combat
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Hitmontop by attacks is increased by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Jumpluff
cards.text: Once it catches the wind, it deftly controls its cotton-puff spores—it can even float around the world.

attacks.name: Mass Attack
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Leaf Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Jumpluff by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Ninetales

abilities.name: Roast Reveal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards. This power can't be used if Ninetales is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Its nine beautiful tails are filled with a wondrous energy that could keep it alive for 1,000 years.

cards.name: Noctowl

abilities.name: Night Sight
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card. This power can't be used if Noctowl is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

cards.name: Quagsire
cards.text: Due to its relaxed and carefree attitude, it often bumps its head on boulders and boat hulls as it swims.

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Raichu
cards.text: If the electric pouches in its cheeks become fully charged, both ears will stand straight up.

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to Raichu.

cards.name: Shuckle

abilities.name: Shell Barricade
abilities.text: As long as Shuckle is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Shuckle by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.text: The berries it stores in its vase-like shell decompose and become a gooey liquid.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Slowking

abilities.name: Second Sight
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 3 cards of that player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order. This power can't be used if Slowking is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: It has incredible intellect and intuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Wobbuffet
cards.text: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to build up its counterstrike.

attacks.name: Double Return
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on Wobbuffet.

cards.name: Ampharos
cards.text: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.

attacks.name: Acceleration Bolt
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Ampharos does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Ariados
cards.text: It spins string not only from its rear but also from its mouth. It's hard to tell which end is which.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove from Ariados the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poisonous Saliva
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Butterfree
cards.text: Water-repellent powder on its wings enables it to collect honey, even in the heaviest of rains.

attacks.name: Cure Powder
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Cleffa

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Cleffa is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Cleffa by attacks.

cards.text: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

attacks.name: Eeeeeeek
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 6 cards. Cleffa is now Asleep.

cards.name: Exeggutor
cards.text: If a head drops off, it emits a telepathic call in search of others to form an Exeggcute cluster.

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to Exeggutor.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Farfetch'd
cards.text: If it eats the plant stalk it carries as emergency rations, it runs off in search of a new stalk.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Spin Turn
attacks.text: Switch Farfetch'd with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Feraligatr
cards.text: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Furret
cards.text: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pokémon to enter.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Granbull
cards.text: Because its fangs are too heavy, it always keeps its head tilted down. However, its bite is powerful.

attacks.name: Timid Tackle
attacks.text: Granbull does 20 damage to itself. Switch Granbull with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chomp
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Granbull.

cards.name: Hypno

abilities.name: Sleep Pendulum
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. This power can't be used if Hypno is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Always holding a pendulum that it swings at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.

attacks.name: Psychic Shot
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Lapras
cards.text: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Ledian
cards.text: The spot patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky.

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Meganium
cards.text: Meganium's breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Giant Bloom
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Meganium.

cards.name: Persian
cards.text: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.

attacks.name: Sharpen Claws
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, discard a card from your opponent's hand without looking.

attacks.name: Sneaky Attack
attacks.text: If Persian has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Pichu

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Pichu is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Pichu by attacks.

cards.text: Despite its small size, it can zap even adult humans. However, if it does so, it also surprises itself.

attacks.name: Playground
attacks.text: Each player may search his or her deck for as many Basic Pokémon as he or she likes, put them onto his or her Bench, and shuffle his or her deck afterward. (You put your Pokémon on the Bench first.) Pichu is now Asleep.

cards.name: Sandslash
cards.text: If it digs at an incredible pace, it may snap off its spike and claws. They grow back in a day.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Smoochum

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Smoochum is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Smoochum by attacks.

cards.text: Its lips are the most sensitive part of its body. It always uses its lips first to examine things.

attacks.name: Energy Antics
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon. Smoochum is now Asleep.

cards.name: Sunflora

abilities.name: Sunshine Grace
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Sunflora is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: It converts sunlight into energy. In the darkness after sunset, it closes its petals and becomes still.

cards.name: Typhlosion
cards.text: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur together to cause huge explosions.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Typhlosion.

cards.name: Tyrogue

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Tyrogue is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Tyrogue by attacks.

cards.text: Even though it is small, it can't be ignored because it will slug any handy target without warning.

attacks.name: Mischievous Punch
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. Tyrogue is now Asleep.

cards.name: Weezing
cards.text: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Super Explosion
attacks.text: Weezing does 90 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness to this damage.

cards.name: Bayleef
cards.text: A spicy aroma emanates from around its neck. The aroma acts as a stimulant to restore health.

cards.name: Blissey
cards.text: Anyone who takes even one taste of Blissey's egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.

attacks.name: Energy Link
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Blissey.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Blissey does 40 damage to itself.

cards.name: Corsola
cards.text: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure because of its beauty.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy attached to Corsola and remove all damage counters from Corsola.

attacks.name: Hyper Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.

cards.name: Croconaw
cards.text: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Delibird
cards.text: It nests at the edge of sharp cliffs. It spends all day carrying food to its awaiting chicks.

attacks.name: Snowy Present
attacks.text: Draw a card for each Water Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Donphan
cards.text: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Dunsparce
cards.text: When spotted, this Pokémon escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.

attacks.name: Glare
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fade Out
attacks.text: Return Dunsparce and all cards attached to it to your hand.

cards.name: Flaaffy
cards.text: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow.

attacks.name: Thunder Spear
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Heracross
cards.text: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies, then lifts and throws them.

attacks.name: Green Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card for each of your Grass Pokémon in play.

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Igglybuff

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Igglybuff is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Igglybuff by attacks.

cards.text: Its extremely flexible and elastic body makes it bounce continuously—anytime, anywhere.

attacks.name: Graffiti
attacks.text: Igglybuff is now Asleep. During your opponent's next turn, the attack cost of each of the Defending Pokémon's attacks is Colorless more.

cards.name: Mantine
cards.text: As it majestically swims, it doesn't care if Remoraid attach to it for scavenging its leftovers.

attacks.name: Group Swim
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: Mantine can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Metapod

abilities.name: Green Shield
abilities.text: Each of your Grass Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.text: It prepares for evolution by hardening its shell as much as possible to protect its soft body.

cards.name: Miltank
cards.text: If it is around babies, the milk it produces contains much more nutrition than usual.

attacks.name: Moomoo Squeeze
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Moomoo Milk card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Parasect
cards.text: The larger the mushroom on its back grows, the stronger the mushroom spores it scatters.

attacks.name: Sleep Drain
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Remove 4 damage counters from Parasect.

cards.name: Quilava
cards.text: This Pokémon is fully covered by nonflammable fur. It can withstand any kind of fire attack.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Quilava.

cards.name: Qwilfish
cards.text: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.

attacks.name: Offensive Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Skiploom
cards.text: The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluctuates up and down.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Slowbro
cards.text: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, it reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke.

attacks.name: Big Yawn
attacks.text: Both Slowbro and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

attacks.name: Madkinesis
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to Slowbro.

cards.name: Starmie
cards.text: The middle section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen.

attacks.name: Cosmic Cyclone
attacks.text: Choose as many Water Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy you chose. Shuffle those cards back into your deck.

cards.name: Unown

abilities.name: RETURN
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown from your hand onto your Bench, you may return all Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to your hand.

cards.text: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

cards.name: Unown

abilities.name: FLASH
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown from your hand onto your Bench, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

cards.text: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.

cards.name: Wigglytuff
cards.text: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a Body Slam.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Wigglytuff by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Caterpie
cards.text: Its feet have suction cups designed to stick to any surface. It tenaciously climbs trees to forage.

cards.name: Chansey
cards.text: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.

attacks.name: Happy Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 3 damage counters from Chansey.

cards.name: Chikorita
cards.text: Its pleasantly aromatic leaf has the ability to check the humidity and temperature.

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Clefairy by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Cyndaquil
cards.text: It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back.

cards.name: Drowzee
cards.text: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Exeggcute
cards.text: Using telepathy only they can employ, they always form a cluster of six Exeggcute.

attacks.name: Continuous Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Girafarig
cards.text: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.

attacks.name: Show Off
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Growlithe
cards.text: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

cards.name: Hoothoot
cards.text: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Hoppip
cards.text: To keep from being blown away by the wind, they gather in clusters. But they do enjoy gentle breezes.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: You may switch Hoppip with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Jigglypuff
cards.text: Looking into its cute, round eyes causes it to sing a relaxing melody, inducing its enemies to sleep.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Jynx
cards.text: It rocks its body rhythmically. It appears to alter the rhythm depending on how it is feeling.

attacks.name: Mimic
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Koffing
cards.text: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Ledyba
cards.text: When the weather turns cold, lots of Ledyba gather from everywhere to cluster and keep each other warm.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Magikarp
cards.text: For no reason, it jumps and splashes about, making it easy for predators like Pidgeotto to catch it mid-jump.

cards.name: Mareep
cards.text: If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.

attacks.name: Static Electricity
attacks.text: Search your deck for a number of Lightning Energy cards up to the number of Mareep in play (both yours and your opponent's) and attach them to Mareep. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Marill
cards.text: The end of its tail serves as a buoy that keeps it from drowning, even in a vicious current.

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Meowth
cards.text: It loves anything that shines. It especially adores coins that it picks up and secretly hoards.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Paras
cards.text: As its body grows large, large mushrooms named tochukaso start sprouting out of its back.

attacks.name: Double-edge Claw
attacks.text: Paras does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Phanpy
cards.text: It swings its long snout around playfully, but because it is so strong, that can be dangerous.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Phanpy.

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Sandshrew
cards.text: Disliking water, it lives in deep burrows in arid areas. It can roll itself instantly into a ball.

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Sandshrew by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Sentret
cards.text: A very cautious Pokémon, it raises itself up using its tail to get a better view of its surroundings.

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Slowpoke
cards.text: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.

attacks.name: Whimsy Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Snubbull
cards.text: It has an active, playful nature. Many women like to frolic with it because of its affectionate ways.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Spinarak
cards.text: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.

attacks.name: Spider Web
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Staryu
cards.text: At night, the center of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.

cards.name: Sunkern
cards.text: It may plummet from the sky. If attacked by a Spearow, it will violently shake its leaves.

attacks.name: Cure Kernels
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Totodile
cards.text: Its powerful, well-developed jaws are capable of crushing anything. Even its trainer must be careful.

cards.name: Vulpix
cards.text: If it is attacked by an enemy that is stronger than itself, it feigns injury to fool the enemy and escapes.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Vulpix.

cards.name: Wooper
cards.text: When it walks around on the ground, it coats its body with a slimy, poisonous film.

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Bill
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Copycat
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Energy Switch
cards.text: Move a basic Energy card attached 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Fisherman
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your discard pile for 4 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

cards.name: Full Heal
cards.text: Remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Moomoo Milk
cards.text: Choose 1 of your Pokémon. Flip 2 coins. For each heads, remove 3 damage counters from that Pokémon.

cards.name: Poké Ball
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Pokégear 3.0
cards.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. Choose a Supporter card you find there, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

cards.name: Pokémon Collector
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Pokémon Communication
cards.text: Choose 1 Pokémon in your hand, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Pokémon Reversal
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, and switch it with your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Professor Elm's Training Method
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Professor Oak's New Theory
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

cards.name: Switch
cards.text: Switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Double Colorless Energy
cards.text: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

cards.name: Rainbow Energy
cards.text: Attach Rainbow Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Rainbow Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.) When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. (While not in play, Rainbow Energy counts as Colorless Energy.)

abilities.name: Conductivity
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to 1 of his or her Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lightning Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage. If tails, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Blissful Nurse
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Blissey from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may remove all damage counters from all of your Pokémon. If you do, discard all Energy attached to those Pokémon that had any damage counters on them.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Donphan by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Rain Dance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Water Pokémon. This power can't be used if Feraligatr is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hydro Crunch
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Leaf Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Grass Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Meganium is affected by a Special Condition.

abilities.name: Afterburner
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Typhlosion is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Flare Destroy
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Typhlosion and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Ho-Oh LEGEND

abilities.name: Sacred Rainbow
abilities.text: All Energy attached to Ho-Oh LEGEND are Fire Energy instead of their usual type.

cards.text: Legends claim this Pokémon flies the world's skies continuously on its magnificent, seven-colored wings.

attacks.name: Bright Wing
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Ho-Oh LEGEND.

cards.name: Ho-Oh LEGEND

abilities.name: Sacred Rainbow
abilities.text: All Energy attached to Ho-Oh LEGEND are Fire Energy instead of their usual type.

cards.text: Legends claim this Pokémon flies the world's skies continuously on its magnificent, seven-colored wings.

attacks.name: Bright Wing
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Ho-Oh LEGEND.

cards.name: Lugia LEGEND

abilities.name: Ocean Grow
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Lugia LEGEND into play, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck and attach all Energy cards you find there to Lugia LEGEND. Discard the other cards.

cards.text: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

attacks.name: Elemental Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy, Water Energy, and Lightning Energy attached to Lugia LEGEND.

cards.name: Lugia LEGEND

abilities.name: Ocean Grow
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Lugia LEGEND into play, you may look at the top 5 cards of your deck and attach all Energy cards you find there to Lugia LEGEND. Discard the other cards.

cards.text: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

attacks.name: Elemental Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy, Water Energy, and Lightning Energy attached to Lugia LEGEND.

cards.name: Gyarados
cards.text: They say that during past strife, Gyarados would appear and leave blazing ruins in its wake.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, Gyarados does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Alph Lithograph
cards.text: Look at your opponent's hand!
